message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CV, cs.CL 

The paper proposes a deep feedforward network architecture for sequential learning of tasks, which is a common topic in machine learning and falls under the category of "cs.LG" (Machine Learning). The architecture is designed to avoid catastrophic forgetting, which is a common problem in neural networks, and this makes "cs.AI" (Artificial Intelligence) another likely sub-category. The proposed architecture can be used for various applications, including computer vision and natural language processing, which makes "cs.CV" (Computer Vision) and "cs.CL" (Computation and Language) possible sub-categories. Finally, the paper mentions that the proposed architecture requires fewer computational resources and less data for learning, which is related to the field of "cs.NE" (Neural and Evolutionary Computing).
